message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.  
• Total Liabilities (from balance sheet) = Total Current Liabilities = 5,042,389.63  
• Total Assets (from balance sheet, End_amount) = 21,098,887.48  
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
  = 5,042,389.63 / 21,098,887.48  
  ≈ 0.2390 → rounded to 0.24  

Step 2: Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.  
• Gross Profit (from income statement) = 194,172.30  
• Total Revenue (from income statement) = 547,392.30  
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
  = (194,172.30 / 547,392.30) × 100%  
  ≈ 35.47%  

Step 3: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.  
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities (from cash flow) = –2,868,695.86  
• Total Current Liabilities = 5,042,389.63  
• Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Current Liabilities  
  = –2,868,695.86 / 5,042,389.63  
  ≈ –0.569 → rounded to –0.57  

Thus, the solution in the required JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.24",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "35.47%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-0.57"
  }
}
